title: Boy or Girl paradox
summary: The Boy or Girl paradox surrounds a set of questions in probability theory, which are also known as The Two Child Problem,[1] Mr. Smith's Children[2] and the Mrs. Smith Problem. The initial formulation of the question dates back to at least 1959, when Martin Gardner featured it in his October 1959 "Mathematical Games column" in Scientific American.
